body.p: Native of Kentucky. Married Susan C Crofton in Kentucky in 1857. Moved to Iowa prior to 1860. Worked as a farmer in Iowa. Commissioned as a captain in Company E of the 15th Iowa infantry after helping to raise a regiment. Suffered a combat injury. Mustered out of the Army at Corinth, MS in July of 1862. Returned to his hometown of Paris, KY where he worked as an assistant in the Provost Marshall's office. After the war, he moved to Colorado and became a judge in Kiowa County.

Spouse: Susan Hutchcraft
Children: Hannah Hutchcraft, James P Hutchcraft
